place.name: SEVINGTON
place.gazetteerText: SEVINGTON, a parish in East Ashford district, Kent; on the Southeastern railway, 2 miles S E of Ashford. Post-town, Ashford. Acres, 832. Real property, £1, 628. Pop., 113. Houses, 22. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. . Value, £250. Patron, the Rev. W. H. Smith. The church is good; and there is a free school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
